Windlord::

Windlord followed Serge, he liked to be sure that Serge was gone, as 
soon as he saw he fired his feathers among Perplex and Serge and 
screamed

"I see that you still want to fight, is your last chance: Go far a 
way or fight with me!!!!"


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "SOULSTICE" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> Serge thought he got far enough away and looked back. He started to 
boil up with fury. He turned around and stared down at Perplex.
> 
> Perplex: I heard your whining as you ran.
> 
> Serge: (Mumbles something not understandable)
> 
> Perplex: I'll give you a head start, RUN!
> 
> Serge just stood there looking at Perplex. Perplex raised his hand, 
showing the disk he was powering earlier. He started to make it grow 
larger and glow more brightly and pulsate faster. Serge walked slowly 
backwards.
> 
> Perplex: Run faster than that if you value life.
> 
> Serge continued to move slowly, planning to duck the disk.
> 
> Meanwhile, Clash flew along, wondering why he had been forced to 
run by those fools back there. His arm was growing back now.
> 
> Clash: How could I, it isn't possible, I am the ultimate being, the 
SUPREME being, I am perfection, I can't be beaten! It's not right, 
what happened? A hex? SOmething, something, huh, huh...
> 
> (At the Cybertronian Fire)
> 
> Deemos: Shokaract, you fool! We were ordered to cease fire! I've 
got to get out of here.
> 
> Deemos flew off away from the battle, contacting Sharpedge.
> 
> Deemos: Sharpedge, you're in command of my position, I can't stand 
to be there anymore.
> 
> Tarantopulous looked around him. Maximals, still firing, worse than 
him even. Why do they act this way? It was only a cease fire? 
Tarantopulous pondered this. After all, as soon as the Maximals get 
their guy back, then they could fire again, right? They were just 
making things harder.
> 
> Tarantopulous (To Kluster): Sir, they are all still firing. This is 
suicide. You have shown me the light, and I am most certain that they 
are killing  themselves! I can't take this.
> 
> With that, Tarantopulous ran from the battle, catching the 
attention of Deemos on his way...
